member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.AugmentedManifestsListItem
member.summary: An augmented manifest file that provides training data for your custom model. An augmented manifest file is a labeled dataset that is produced by Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.AugmentedManifestsListItem.AnnotationDataS3Uri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AnnotationDataS3Uri.
The S3 prefix to the annotation files that are referred in the augmented manifest file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.AugmentedManifestsListItem.AttributeNames
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeNames.
The JSON attribute that contains the annotations for your training documents. The number of attribute names that you specify depends on whether your augmented manifest file is the output of a single labeling job or a chained labeling job.
If your file is the output of a single labeling job, specify the LabelAttributeName key that was used when the job was created in Ground Truth.
If your file is the output of a chained labeling job, specify the LabelAttributeName key for one or more jobs in the chain. Each LabelAttributeName key provides the annotations from an individual job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.AugmentedManifestsListItem.DocumentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentType.
The type of augmented manifest. PlainTextDocument or SemiStructuredDocument. If you don't specify, the default is PlainTextDocument.
PLAIN_TEXT_DOCUMENT A document type that represents any unicode text that is encoded in UTF-8.
SEMI_STRUCTURED_DOCUMENT A document type with positional and structural context, like a PDF. For training with Amazon Comprehend, only PDFs are supported. For inference, Amazon Comprehend support PDFs, DOCX and TXT.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.AugmentedManifestsListItem.S3Uri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Uri.
The Amazon S3 location of the augmented manifest file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.AugmentedManifestsListItem.SourceDocumentsS3Uri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceDocumentsS3Uri.
The S3 prefix to the source files (PDFs) that are referred to in the augmented manifest file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.AugmentedManifestsListItem.Split
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Split.
The purpose of the data you've provided in the augmented manifest. You can either train or test this data. If you don't specify, the default is train.
TRAIN - all of the documents in the manifest will be used for training. If no test documents are provided, Amazon Comprehend will automatically reserve a portion of the training documents for testing.
TEST - all of the documents in the manifest will be used for testing.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult
member.summary: The result of calling the operation. The operation returns one object for each document that is successfully processed by the operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult.Index
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Index.
The zero-based index of the document in the input list.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.BatchDetectDominantLanguageItemResult.Languages
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Languages.
One or more DominantLanguage objects describing the dominant languages in the document.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.BatchDetectDominantLanguageRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the BatchDetectDominantLanguage operation. Determines the dominant language of the input text for a batch of documents. For a list of languages that Amazon Comprehend can detect, see Amazon Comprehend Supported Languages.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.BatchDetectDominantLanguageRequest.TextList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TextList.
A list containing the text of the input documents. The list can contain a maximum of 25 documents. Each document should contain at least 20 characters and must contain fewer than 5,000 bytes of UTF-8 encoded characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.BatchDetectDominantLanguageResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the BatchDetectDominantLanguage operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.BatchDetectDominantLanguageResponse.ErrorList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorList.
A list containing one object for each document that contained an error. The results are sorted in ascending order by the Index field and match the order of the documents in the input list. If there are no errors in the batch, the ErrorList is empty.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.BatchDetectDominantLanguageResponse.ResultList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResultList.
A list of objects containing the results of the operation. The results are sorted in ascending order by the Index field and match the order of the documents in the input list. If all of the documents contain an error, the ResultList is empty.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifierEvaluationMetrics
member.summary: Describes the result metrics for the test data associated with an documentation classifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifierEvaluationMetrics.Accuracy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Accuracy.
The fraction of the labels that were correct recognized. It is computed by dividing the number of labels in the test documents that were correctly recognized by the total number of labels in the test documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifierEvaluationMetrics.F1Score
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property F1Score.
A measure of how accurate the classifier results are for the test data. It is derived from the Precision and Recall values. The F1Score is the harmonic average of the two scores. The highest score is 1, and the worst score is 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifierEvaluationMetrics.HammingLoss
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HammingLoss.
Indicates the fraction of labels that are incorrectly predicted. Also seen as the fraction of wrong labels compared to the total number of labels. Scores closer to zero are better.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifierEvaluationMetrics.MicroF1Score
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MicroF1Score.
A measure of how accurate the classifier results are for the test data. It is a combination of the Micro Precision and Micro Recall values. The Micro F1Score is the harmonic mean of the two scores. The highest score is 1, and the worst score is 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifierEvaluationMetrics.MicroPrecision
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MicroPrecision.
A measure of the usefulness of the recognizer results in the test data. High precision means that the recognizer returned substantially more relevant results than irrelevant ones. Unlike the Precision metric which comes from averaging the precision of all available labels, this is based on the overall score of all precision scores added together.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifierEvaluationMetrics.MicroRecall
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MicroRecall.
A measure of how complete the classifier results are for the test data. High recall means that the classifier returned most of the relevant results. Specifically, this indicates how many of the correct categories in the text that the model can predict. It is a percentage of correct categories in the text that can found. Instead of averaging the recall scores of all labels (as with Recall), micro Recall is based on the overall score of all recall scores added together.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifierEvaluationMetrics.Precision
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Precision.
A measure of the usefulness of the classifier results in the test data. High precision means that the classifier returned substantially more relevant results than irrelevant ones.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifierEvaluationMetrics.Recall
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Recall.
A measure of how complete the classifier results are for the test data. High recall means that the classifier returned most of the relevant results.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifierMetadata
member.summary: Provides information about a document classifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifierMetadata.EvaluationMetrics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EvaluationMetrics.
Describes the result metrics for the test data associated with an documentation classifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifierMetadata.NumberOfLabels
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NumberOfLabels.
The number of labels in the input data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifierMetadata.NumberOfTestDocuments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NumberOfTestDocuments.
The number of documents in the input data that were used to test the classifier. Typically this is 10 to 20 percent of the input documents, up to 10,000 documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifierMetadata.NumberOfTrainedDocuments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NumberOfTrainedDocuments.
The number of documents in the input data that were used to train the classifier. Typically this is 80 to 90 percent of the input documents.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifyDocumentRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ClassifyDocument operation. Creates a new document classification request to analyze a single document in real-time, using a previously created and trained custom model and an endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifyDocumentRequest.EndpointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointArn.
The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifyDocumentRequest.Text
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Text.
The document text to be analyzed.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifyDocumentResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ClassifyDocument operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifyDocumentResponse.Classes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Classes.
The classes used by the document being analyzed. These are used for multi-class trained models. Individual classes are mutually exclusive and each document is expected to have only a single class assigned to it. For example, an animal can be a dog or a cat, but not both at the same time.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ClassifyDocumentResponse.Labels
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Labels.
The labels used the document being analyzed. These are used for multi-label trained models. Individual labels represent different categories that are related in some manner and are not mutually exclusive. For example, a movie can be just an action movie, or it can be an action movie, a science fiction movie, and a comedy, all at the same time.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateDocumentClassifierRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateDocumentClassifier operation. Creates a new document classifier that you can use to categorize documents. To create a classifier, you provide a set of training documents that labeled with the categories that you want to use. After the classifier is trained you can use it to categorize a set of labeled documents into the categories. For more information, see how-document-classification.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateDocumentClassifierRequest.ClientRequestToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientRequestToken.
A unique identifier for the request. If you don't set the client request token, Amazon Comprehend generates one.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateDocumentClassifierRequest.DataAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataAccessRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Management (IAM) role that grants Amazon Comprehend read access to your input data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateDocumentClassifierRequest.DocumentClassifierName
member.summary:

The name of the document classifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateDocumentClassifierRequest.InputDataConfig

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LanguageCode.
The language of the input documents. You can specify any of the following languages supported by Amazon Comprehend: German ("de"), English ("en"), Spanish ("es"), French ("fr"), Italian ("it"), or Portuguese ("pt"). All documents must be in the same language.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateDocumentClassifierRequest.Mode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Mode.
Indicates the mode in which the classifier will be trained. The classifier can be trained in multi-class mode, which identifies one and only one class for each document, or multi-label mode, which identifies one or more labels for each document. In multi-label mode, multiple labels for an individual document are separated by a delimiter. The default delimiter between labels is a pipe (|).

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateDocumentClassifierRequest.ModelKmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ModelKmsKeyId.
ID for the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt trained custom models. The ModelKmsKeyId can be either of the following formats:
KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateDocumentClassifierRequest.OutputDataConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputDataConfig.
Enables the addition of output results configuration parameters for custom classifier jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateDocumentClassifierRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Tags to be associated with the document classifier being created. A tag is a key-value pair that adds as a metadata to a resource used by Amazon Comprehend. For example, a tag with "Sales" as the key might be added to a resource to indicate its use by the sales department.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateDocumentClassifierRequest.VersionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VersionName.
The version name given to the newly created classifier. Version names can have a maximum of 256 characters. Alphanumeric characters, hyphens (-) and underscores (_) are allowed. The version name must be unique among all models with the same classifier name in the account/AWS Region.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateDocumentClassifierRequest.VolumeKmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VolumeKmsKeyId.
ID for the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that process the analysis job. The VolumeKmsKeyId can be either of the following formats:
KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateDocumentClassifierRequest.VpcConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfig.
Configuration parameters for an optional private Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) containing the resources you are using for your custom classifier. For more information, see Amazon VPC.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateDocumentClassifierResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateDocumentClassifier operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateDocumentClassifierResponse.DocumentClassifierArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentClassifierArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the document classifier.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateEndpointRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateEndpoint operation. Creates a model-specific endpoint for synchronous inference for a previously trained custom model

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateEndpointRequest.ClientRequestToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientRequestToken.
An idempotency token provided by the customer. If this token matches a previous endpoint creation request, Amazon Comprehend will not return a ResourceInUseException.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateEndpointRequest.DataAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataAccessRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS identity and Access Management (IAM) role that grants Amazon Comprehend read access to trained custom models encrypted with a customer managed key (ModelKmsKeyId).

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateEndpointRequest.DesiredInferenceUnits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DesiredInferenceUnits.
The desired number of inference units to be used by the model using this endpoint. Each inference unit represents of a throughput of 100 characters per second.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateEndpointRequest.EndpointName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointName.
This is the descriptive suffix that becomes part of the EndpointArn used for all subsequent requests to this resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateEndpointRequest.ModelArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ModelArn.
The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the model to which the endpoint will be attached.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateEndpointRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Tags associated with the endpoint being created. A tag is a key-value pair that adds metadata to the endpoint. For example, a tag with "Sales" as the key might be added to an endpoint to indicate its use by the sales department.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateEndpointResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateEndpoint operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateEndpointResponse.EndpointArn
member.summary:

The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the endpoint being created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateEntityRecognizerRequest.LanguageCode
member.summary:

The name given to the newly created recognizer. Recognizer names can be a maximum of 256 characters. Alphanumeric characters, hyphens (-) and underscores (_) are allowed. The name must be unique in the account/region.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.CreateEntityRecognizerRequest.VersionName

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DeleteDocumentClassifierRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteDocumentClassifier operation. Deletes a previously created document classifier
Only those classifiers that are in terminated states (IN_ERROR, TRAINED) will be deleted. If an active inference job is using the model, a ResourceInUseException will be returned.
This is an asynchronous action that puts the classifier into a DELETING state, and it is then removed by a background job. Once removed, the classifier disappears from your account and is no longer available for use.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DeleteDocumentClassifierRequest.DocumentClassifierArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentClassifierArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the document classifier.

member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteDocumentClassifier operation.

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteEndpoint operation. Deletes a model-specific endpoint for a previously-trained custom model. All endpoints must be deleted in order for the model to be deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DeleteEndpointRequest.EndpointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointArn.
The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the endpoint being deleted.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DeleteEndpointResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteEndpoint operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DeleteEntityRecognizerRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteEntityRecognizer operation. Deletes an entity recognizer.
Only those recognizers that are in terminated states (IN_ERROR, TRAINED) will be deleted. If an active inference job is using the model, a ResourceInUseException will be returned.
This is an asynchronous action that puts the recognizer into a DELETING state, and it is then removed by a background job. Once removed, the recognizer disappears from your account and is no longer available for use.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectDominantLanguageRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DetectDominantLanguage operation. Determines the dominant language of the input text. For a list of languages that Amazon Comprehend can detect, see Amazon Comprehend Supported Languages.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectDominantLanguageRequest.Text
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Text.
A UTF-8 text string. Each string should contain at least 20 characters and must contain fewer that 5,000 bytes of UTF-8 encoded characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectDominantLanguageResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DetectDominantLanguage operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectDominantLanguageResponse.Languages
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Languages.
The languages that Amazon Comprehend detected in the input text. For each language, the response returns the RFC 5646 language code and the level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of its inference. For more information about RFC 5646, see Tags for Identifying Languages on the IETF Tools web site.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectEntitiesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DetectEntities operation. Inspects text for named entities, and returns information about them. For more information, about named entities, see how-entities.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectEntitiesRequest.EndpointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointArn.
The Amazon Resource Name of an endpoint that is associated with a custom entity recognition model. Provide an endpoint if you want to detect entities by using your own custom model instead of the default model that is used by Amazon Comprehend.
If you specify an endpoint, Amazon Comprehend uses the language of your custom model, and it ignores any language code that you provide in your request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectEntitiesRequest.LanguageCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LanguageCode.
The language of the input documents. You can specify any of the primary languages supported by Amazon Comprehend. All documents must be in the same language.
If your request includes the endpoint for a custom entity recognition model, Amazon Comprehend uses the language of your custom model, and it ignores any language code that you specify here.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectEntitiesRequest.Text
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Text.
A UTF-8 text string. Each string must contain fewer that 5,000 bytes of UTF-8 encoded characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectEntitiesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DetectEntities operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectEntitiesResponse.Entities
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Entities.
A collection of entities identified in the input text. For each entity, the response provides the entity text, entity type, where the entity text begins and ends, and the level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the detection.
If your request uses a custom entity recognition model, Amazon Comprehend detects the entities that the model is trained to recognize. Otherwise, it detects the default entity types. For a list of default entity types, see how-entities.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectKeyPhrasesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DetectKeyPhrases operation. Detects the key noun phrases found in the text.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectKeyPhrasesRequest.LanguageCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LanguageCode.
The language of the input documents. You can specify any of the primary languages supported by Amazon Comprehend. All documents must be in the same language.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectKeyPhrasesRequest.Text
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Text.
A UTF-8 text string. Each string must contain fewer that 5,000 bytes of UTF-8 encoded characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectKeyPhrasesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DetectKeyPhrases operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectKeyPhrasesResponse.KeyPhrases
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KeyPhrases.
A collection of key phrases that Amazon Comprehend identified in the input text. For each key phrase, the response provides the text of the key phrase, where the key phrase begins and ends, and the level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of the detection.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DetectSyntaxResponse.SyntaxTokens
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SyntaxTokens.
A collection of syntax tokens describing the text. For each token, the response provides the text, the token type, where the text begins and ends, and the level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has that the token is correct. For a list of token types, see how-syntax.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobFilter
member.summary: Provides information for filtering a list of document classification jobs. For more information, see the operation. You can provide only one filter parameter in each request.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobName.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobFilter.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
Filters the list based on job status. Returns only jobs with the specified status.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobFilter.SubmitTimeAfter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubmitTimeAfter.
Filters the list of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted for processing. Returns only jobs submitted after the specified time. Jobs are returned in descending order, newest to oldest.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobFilter.SubmitTimeBefore
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubmitTimeBefore.
Filters the list of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted for processing. Returns only jobs submitted before the specified time. Jobs are returned in ascending order, oldest to newest.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobProperties
member.summary: Provides information about a document classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobProperties.DataAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataAccessRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS identity and Access Management (IAM) role that grants Amazon Comprehend read access to your input data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobProperties.DocumentClassifierArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentClassifierArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the document classifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobProperties.EndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndTime.
The time that the document classification job completed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobProperties.InputDataConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InputDataConfig.
The input data configuration that you supplied when you created the document classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobProperties.JobArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the document classification job. It is a unique, fully qualified identifier for the job. It includes the AWS account, Region, and the job ID. The format of the ARN is as follows:
arn:<partition>:comprehend:<region>:<account-id>:document-classification-job/<job-id>
The following is an example job ARN:
arn:aws:comprehend:us-west-2:111122223333:document-classification-job/1234abcd12ab34cd56ef1234567890ab

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobProperties.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The identifier assigned to the document classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobProperties.JobName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobName.
The name that you assigned to the document classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobProperties.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
The current status of the document classification job. If the status is FAILED, the Message field shows the reason for the failure.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobProperties.Message
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Message.
A description of the status of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobProperties.OutputDataConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputDataConfig.
The output data configuration that you supplied when you created the document classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobProperties.SubmitTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubmitTime.
The time that the document classification job was submitted for processing.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobProperties.VolumeKmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VolumeKmsKeyId.
ID for the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that process the analysis job. The VolumeKmsKeyId can be either of the following formats:
KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassificationJobProperties.VpcConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfig.
Configuration parameters for a private Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) containing the resources you are using for your document classification job. For more information, see Amazon VPC.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierFilter.SubmitTimeAfter
member.summary:

Filters the list of classifiers based on the time that the classifier was submitted for processing. Returns only classifiers submitted after the specified time. Classifiers are returned in descending order, newest to oldest.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierFilter.SubmitTimeBefore
member.summary:

Filters the list of classifiers based on the time that the classifier was submitted for processing. Returns only classifiers submitted before the specified time. Classifiers are returned in ascending order, oldest to newest.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig
member.summary:
The input properties for training a document classifier.
For more information on how the input file is formatted, see how-document-classification-training-data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig.AugmentedManifests
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AugmentedManifests.
A list of augmented manifest files that provide training data for your custom model. An augmented manifest file is a labeled dataset that is produced by Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth.
This parameter is required if you set DataFormat to AUGMENTED_MANIFEST.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig.DataFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataFormat.
The format of your training data:
COMPREHEND_CSV: A two-column CSV file, where labels are provided in the first column, and documents are provided in the second. If you use this value, you must provide the S3Uri parameter in your request.
AUGMENTED_MANIFEST: A labeled dataset that is produced by Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth. This file is in JSON lines format. Each line is a complete JSON object that contains a training document and its associated labels.
If you use this value, you must provide the AugmentedManifests parameter in your request.
If you don't specify a value, Amazon Comprehend uses COMPREHEND_CSV as the default.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig.LabelDelimiter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LabelDelimiter.
Indicates the delimiter used to separate each label for training a multi-label classifier. The default delimiter between labels is a pipe (|). You can use a different character as a delimiter (if it's an allowed character) by specifying it under Delimiter for labels. If the training documents use a delimiter other than the default or the delimiter you specify, the labels on that line will be combined to make a single unique label, such as LABELLABELLABEL.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig.S3Uri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Uri.
The Amazon S3 URI for the input data. The S3 bucket must be in the same region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The URI can point to a single input file or it can provide the prefix for a collection of input files.
For example, if you use the URI S3://bucketName/prefix, if the prefix is a single file, Amazon Comprehend uses that file as input. If more than one file begins with the prefix, Amazon Comprehend uses all of them as input.
This parameter is required if you set DataFormat to COMPREHEND_CSV.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierInputDataConfig.TestS3Uri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TestS3Uri.
The Amazon S3 URI for the input data. The Amazon S3 bucket must be in the same AWS Region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The URI can point to a single input file or it can provide the prefix for a collection of input files.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig
member.summary: Provides output results configuration parameters for custom classifier jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig.KmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyId.
ID for the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt the output results from an analysis job. The KmsKeyId can be one of the following formats:
KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"
ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias"

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierOutputDataConfig.S3Uri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Uri.
When you use the OutputDataConfig object while creating a custom classifier, you specify the Amazon S3 location where you want to write the confusion matrix. The URI must be in the same region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The location is used as the prefix for the actual location of this output file.
When the custom classifier job is finished, the service creates the output file in a directory specific to the job. The S3Uri field contains the location of the output file, called output.tar.gz. It is a compressed archive that contains the confusion matrix.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties
member.summary: Provides information about a document classifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties.ClassifierMetadata
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClassifierMetadata.
Information about the document classifier, including the number of documents used for training the classifier, the number of documents used for test the classifier, and an accuracy rating.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties.DataAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataAccessRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Management (IAM) role that grants Amazon Comprehend read access to your input data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties.DocumentClassifierArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentClassifierArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the document classifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties.EndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndTime.
The time that training the document classifier completed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties.InputDataConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InputDataConfig.
The input data configuration that you supplied when you created the document classifier for training.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties.LanguageCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LanguageCode.
The language code for the language of the documents that the classifier was trained on.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties.Message
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Message.
Additional information about the status of the classifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties.Mode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Mode.
Indicates the mode in which the specific classifier was trained. This also indicates the format of input documents and the format of the confusion matrix. Each classifier can only be trained in one mode and this cannot be changed once the classifier is trained.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties.ModelKmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ModelKmsKeyId.
ID for the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt trained custom models. The ModelKmsKeyId can be either of the following formats:
KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties.OutputDataConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputDataConfig.
Provides output results configuration parameters for custom classifier jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the document classifier. If the status is TRAINED the classifier is ready to use. If the status is FAILED you can see additional information about why the classifier wasn't trained in the Message field.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties.SubmitTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubmitTime.
The time that the document classifier was submitted for training.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties.TrainingEndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TrainingEndTime.
The time that training of the document classifier was completed. Indicates the time when the training completes on documentation classifiers. You are billed for the time interval between this time and the value of TrainingStartTime.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentClassifierProperties.TrainingStartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TrainingStartTime.
Indicates the time when the training starts on documentation classifiers. You are billed for the time interval between this time and the value of TrainingEndTime.

member.summary: The input properties for a topic detection job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentReaderConfig.DocumentReadAction
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentReadAction.
This enum field will start with two values which will apply to PDFs:
TEXTRACT_DETECT_DOCUMENT_TEXT - The service calls DetectDocumentText for PDF documents per page.
TEXTRACT_ANALYZE_DOCUMENT - The service calls AnalyzeDocument for PDF documents per page.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.DocumentReaderConfig.DocumentReadMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentReadMode.
This enum field provides two values:
SERVICE_DEFAULT - use service defaults for Document reading. For Digital PDF it would mean using an internal parser instead of Textract APIs
FORCE_DOCUMENT_READ_ACTION - Always use specified action for DocumentReadAction, including Digital PDF.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the entities detection job. It is a unique, fully qualified identifier for the job. It includes the AWS account, Region, and the job ID. The format of the ARN is as follows:
arn:<partition>:comprehend:<region>:<account-id>:entities-detection-job/<job-id>
The following is an example job ARN:
arn:aws:comprehend:us-west-2:111122223333:entities-detection-job/1234abcd12ab34cd56ef1234567890ab

KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.Entity
member.summary: Provides information about an entity.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.Entity.BeginOffset
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BeginOffset.
A character offset in the input text that shows where the entity begins (the first character is at position 0). The offset returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A code point is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.Entity.EndOffset
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndOffset.
A character offset in the input text that shows where the entity ends. The offset returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A code point is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerAnnotations.TestS3Uri
member.summary:

This specifies the Amazon S3 location where the test annotations for an entity recognizer are located. The URI must be in the same AWS Region as the API endpoint that you are calling.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerDocuments
member.summary: Describes the training documents submitted with an entity recognizer.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerDocuments.InputFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InputFormat.
Specifies how the text in an input file should be processed. This is optional, and the default is ONE_DOC_PER_LINE. ONE_DOC_PER_FILE - Each file is considered a separate document. Use this option when you are processing large documents, such as newspaper articles or scientific papers. ONE_DOC_PER_LINE - Each line in a file is considered a separate document. Use this option when you are processing many short documents, such as text messages.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerDocuments.S3Uri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Uri.
Specifies the Amazon S3 location where the training documents for an entity recognizer are located. The URI must be in the same region as the API endpoint that you are calling.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerDocuments.TestS3Uri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TestS3Uri.
Specifies the Amazon S3 location where the test documents for an entity recognizer are located. The URI must be in the same AWS Region as the API endpoint that you are calling.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics
member.summary: Detailed information about the accuracy of an entity recognizer.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics.F1Score
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property F1Score.
A measure of how accurate the recognizer results are for the test data. It is derived from the Precision and Recall values. The F1Score is the harmonic average of the two scores. The highest score is 1, and the worst score is 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics.Precision
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Precision.
A measure of the usefulness of the recognizer results in the test data. High precision means that the recognizer returned substantially more relevant results than irrelevant ones.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerEvaluationMetrics.Recall
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Recall.
A measure of how complete the recognizer results are for the test data. High recall means that the recognizer returned most of the relevant results.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig
member.summary: Specifies the format and location of the input data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig.Annotations
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Annotations.
The S3 location of the CSV file that annotates your training documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig.AugmentedManifests
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AugmentedManifests.
A list of augmented manifest files that provide training data for your custom model. An augmented manifest file is a labeled dataset that is produced by Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth.
This parameter is required if you set DataFormat to AUGMENTED_MANIFEST.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig.DataFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataFormat.
The format of your training data:
COMPREHEND_CSV: A CSV file that supplements your training documents. The CSV file contains information about the custom entities that your trained model will detect. The required format of the file depends on whether you are providing annotations or an entity list.
If you use this value, you must provide your CSV file by using either the Annotations or EntityList parameters. You must provide your training documents by using the Documents parameter.
AUGMENTED_MANIFEST: A labeled dataset that is produced by Amazon SageMaker Ground Truth. This file is in JSON lines format. Each line is a complete JSON object that contains a training document and its labels. Each label annotates a named entity in the training document.
If you use this value, you must provide the AugmentedManifests parameter in your request.
If you don't specify a value, Amazon Comprehend uses COMPREHEND_CSV as the default.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig.Documents
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Documents.
The S3 location of the folder that contains the training documents for your custom entity recognizer.
This parameter is required if you set DataFormat to COMPREHEND_CSV.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig.EntityList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EntityList.
The S3 location of the CSV file that has the entity list for your custom entity recognizer.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.EntityRecognizerInputDataConfig.EntityTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EntityTypes.
The entity types in the labeled training data that Amazon Comprehend uses to train the custom entity recognizer. Any entity types that you don't specify are ignored.
A maximum of 25 entity types can be used at one time to train an entity recognizer. Entity types must not contain the following invalid characters: \n (line break), \\n (escaped line break), \r (carriage return), \\r (escaped carriage return), \t (tab), \\t (escaped tab), space, and , (comma).

member.summary:

A measure of how accurate the recognizer results are for a specific entity type in the test data. It is derived from the Precision and Recall values. The F1Score is the harmonic average of the two scores. The highest score is 1, and the worst score is 0.

member.summary: The input properties for an inference job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.InputDataConfig.DocumentReaderConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentReaderConfig.
The document reader config field applies only for InputDataConfig of StartEntitiesDetectionJob.
Use DocumentReaderConfig to provide specifications about how you want your inference documents read. Currently it applies for PDF documents in StartEntitiesDetectionJob custom inference.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.InputDataConfig.InputFormat
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InputFormat.
Specifies how the text in an input file should be processed:
ONE_DOC_PER_FILE - Each file is considered a separate document. Use this option when you are processing large documents, such as newspaper articles or scientific papers.
ONE_DOC_PER_LINE - Each line in a file is considered a separate document. Use this option when you are processing many short documents, such as text messages.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.InputDataConfig.S3Uri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Uri.
The Amazon S3 URI for the input data. The URI must be in same region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The URI can point to a single input file or it can provide the prefix for a collection of data files.
For example, if you use the URI S3://bucketName/prefix, if the prefix is a single file, Amazon Comprehend uses that file as input. If more than one file begins with the prefix, Amazon Comprehend uses all of them as input.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrase
member.summary: Describes a key noun phrase.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrase.BeginOffset
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BeginOffset.
A character offset in the input text that shows where the key phrase begins (the first character is at position 0). The offset returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A code point is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrase.EndOffset
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndOffset.
A character offset in the input text where the key phrase ends. The offset returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A code point is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrase.Score
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Score.
The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of the detection.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrase.Text
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Text.
The text of a key noun phrase.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobFilter
member.summary: Provides information for filtering a list of dominant language detection jobs. For more information, see the operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobFilter.JobName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobName.
Filters on the name of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobFilter.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
Filters the list of jobs based on job status. Returns only jobs with the specified status.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobFilter.SubmitTimeAfter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubmitTimeAfter.
Filters the list of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted for processing. Returns only jobs submitted after the specified time. Jobs are returned in descending order, newest to oldest.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobFilter.SubmitTimeBefore
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubmitTimeBefore.
Filters the list of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted for processing. Returns only jobs submitted before the specified time. Jobs are returned in ascending order, oldest to newest.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties
member.summary: Provides information about a key phrases detection job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties.DataAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataAccessRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that gives Amazon Comprehend read access to your input data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties.EndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndTime.
The time that the key phrases detection job completed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties.InputDataConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InputDataConfig.
The input data configuration that you supplied when you created the key phrases detection job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties.JobArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the key phrases detection job. It is a unique, fully qualified identifier for the job. It includes the AWS account, Region, and the job ID. The format of the ARN is as follows:
arn:<partition>:comprehend:<region>:<account-id>:key-phrases-detection-job/<job-id>
The following is an example job ARN:
arn:aws:comprehend:us-west-2:111122223333:key-phrases-detection-job/1234abcd12ab34cd56ef1234567890ab

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The identifier assigned to the key phrases detection job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties.JobName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobName.
The name that you assigned the key phrases detection job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
The current status of the key phrases detection job. If the status is FAILED, the Message field shows the reason for the failure.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties.LanguageCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LanguageCode.
The language code of the input documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties.Message
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Message.
A description of the status of a job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties.OutputDataConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputDataConfig.
The output data configuration that you supplied when you created the key phrases detection job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties.SubmitTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubmitTime.
The time that the key phrases detection job was submitted for processing.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties.VolumeKmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VolumeKmsKeyId.
ID for the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that process the analysis job. The VolumeKmsKeyId can be either of the following formats:
KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.KeyPhrasesDetectionJobProperties.VpcConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfig.
Configuration parameters for a private Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) containing the resources you are using for your key phrases detection job. For more information, see Amazon VPC.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.ListEntityRecognizersRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListEntityRecognizers operation. Gets a list of the properties of all entity recognizers that you created, including recognizers currently in training. Allows you to filter the list of recognizers based on criteria such as status and submission time. This call returns up to 500 entity recognizers in the list, with a default number of 100 recognizers in the list.
The results of this list are not in any particular order. Please get the list and sort locally if needed.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.OutputDataConfig
member.summary: Provides configuration parameters for the output of topic detection jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.OutputDataConfig.KmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyId.
ID for the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt the output results from an analysis job. The KmsKeyId can be one of the following formats:
KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
KMS Key Alias: "alias/ExampleAlias"
ARN of a KMS Key Alias: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias"

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.OutputDataConfig.S3Uri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Uri.
When you use the OutputDataConfig object with asynchronous operations, you specify the Amazon S3 location where you want to write the output data. The URI must be in the same region as the API endpoint that you are calling. The location is used as the prefix for the actual location of the output file.
When the topic detection job is finished, the service creates an output file in a directory specific to the job. The S3Uri field contains the location of the output file, called output.tar.gz. It is a compressed archive that contains the ouput of the operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.PiiEntity
member.summary: Provides information about a PII entity.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.PiiEntity.BeginOffset
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BeginOffset.
A character offset in the input text that shows where the PII entity begins (the first character is at position 0). The offset returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A code point is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.PiiEntity.EndOffset
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndOffset.
A character offset in the input text that shows where the PII entity ends. The offset returns the position of each UTF-8 code point in the string. A code point is the abstract character from a particular graphical representation. For example, a multi-byte UTF-8 character maps to a single code point.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.PiiEntity.Score
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartDocumentClassificationJobRequest.VolumeKmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VolumeKmsKeyId.
ID for the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that process the analysis job. The VolumeKmsKeyId can be either of the following formats:
KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

member.summary: This is the response object from the StartDocumentClassificationJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartDocumentClassificationJobResponse.JobArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the document classification job. It is a unique, fully qualified identifier for the job. It includes the AWS account, Region, and the job ID. The format of the ARN is as follows:
arn:<partition>:comprehend:<region>:<account-id>:document-classification-job/<job-id>
The following is an example job ARN:
arn:aws:comprehend:us-west-2:111122223333:document-classification-job/1234abcd12ab34cd56ef1234567890ab

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartDocumentClassificationJobResponse.JobId
member.summary:

The identifier generated for the job. To get the status of the job, use this identifier with the operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartDocumentClassificationJobResponse.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
The status of the job:
SUBMITTED - The job has been received and queued for processing.
IN_PROGRESS - Amazon Comprehend is processing the job.
COMPLETED - The job was successfully completed and the output is available.
FAILED - The job did not complete. For details, use the operation.
STOP_REQUESTED - Amazon Comprehend has received a stop request for the job and is processing the request.
STOPPED - The job was successfully stopped without completing.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartEntitiesDetectionJobRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the StartEntitiesDetectionJob operation. Starts an asynchronous entity detection job for a collection of documents. Use the operation to track the status of a job.
This API can be used for either standard entity detection or custom entity recognition. In order to be used for custom entity recognition, the optional EntityRecognizerArn must be used in order to provide access to the recognizer being used to detect the custom entity.

member.summary:

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EntityRecognizerArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the specific entity recognizer to be used by the StartEntitiesDetectionJob. This ARN is optional and is only used for a custom entity recognition job.

The identifier of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartEntitiesDetectionJobRequest.LanguageCode
member.summary:

The language of the input documents. All documents must be in the same language. You can specify any of the languages supported by Amazon Comprehend. If custom entities recognition is used, this parameter is ignored and the language used for training the model is used instead.

Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
The status of the job.
SUBMITTED - The job has been received and is queued for processing.
IN_PROGRESS - Amazon Comprehend is processing the job.
COMPLETED - The job was successfully completed and the output is available.
FAILED - The job did not complete. To get details, use the operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartTopicsDetectionJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the StartTopicsDetectionJob operation. Starts an asynchronous topic detection job. Use the DescribeTopicDetectionJob operation to track the status of a job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartTopicsDetectionJobRequest.ClientRequestToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientRequestToken.
A unique identifier for the request. If you do not set the client request token, Amazon Comprehend generates one.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartTopicsDetectionJobRequest.DataAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataAccessRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that grants Amazon Comprehend read access to your input data. For more information, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/comprehend/latest/dg/access-control-managing-permissions.html#auth-role-permissions.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartTopicsDetectionJobRequest.InputDataConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InputDataConfig.
Specifies the format and location of the input data for the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartTopicsDetectionJobRequest.JobName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobName.
The identifier of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartTopicsDetectionJobRequest.NumberOfTopics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NumberOfTopics.
The number of topics to detect.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartTopicsDetectionJobRequest.OutputDataConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputDataConfig.
Specifies where to send the output files. The output is a compressed archive with two files, topic-terms.csv that lists the terms associated with each topic, and doc-topics.csv that lists the documents associated with each topic

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartTopicsDetectionJobRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Tags to be associated with the topics detection job. A tag is a key-value pair that adds metadata to a resource used by Amazon Comprehend. For example, a tag with "Sales" as the key might be added to a resource to indicate its use by the sales department.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartTopicsDetectionJobRequest.VolumeKmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VolumeKmsKeyId.
ID for the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that process the analysis job. The VolumeKmsKeyId can be either of the following formats:
KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartTopicsDetectionJobRequest.VpcConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfig.
Configuration parameters for an optional private Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) containing the resources you are using for your topic detection job. For more information, see Amazon VPC.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartTopicsDetectionJobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StartTopicsDetectionJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartTopicsDetectionJobResponse.JobArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the topics detection job. It is a unique, fully qualified identifier for the job. It includes the AWS account, Region, and the job ID. The format of the ARN is as follows:
arn:<partition>:comprehend:<region>:<account-id>:topics-detection-job/<job-id>
The following is an example job ARN:
arn:aws:comprehend:us-west-2:111122223333:document-classification-job/1234abcd12ab34cd56ef1234567890ab

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartTopicsDetectionJobResponse.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The identifier generated for the job. To get the status of the job, use this identifier with the DescribeTopicDetectionJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StartTopicsDetectionJobResponse.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
The status of the job:
SUBMITTED - The job has been received and is queued for processing.
IN_PROGRESS - Amazon Comprehend is processing the job.
COMPLETED - The job was successfully completed and the output is available.
FAILED - The job did not complete. To get details, use the DescribeTopicDetectionJob operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StopDominantLanguageDetectionJobRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the StopDominantLanguageDetectionJob operation. Stops a dominant language detection job in progress.
If the job state is IN_PROGRESS the job is marked for termination and put into the STOP_REQUESTED state. If the job completes before it can be stopped, it is put into the COMPLETED state; otherwise the job is stopped and put into the STOPPED state.
If the job is in the COMPLETED or FAILED state when you call the StopDominantLanguageDetectionJob operation, the operation returns a 400 Internal Request Exception.
When a job is stopped, any documents already processed are written to the output location.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StopDominantLanguageDetectionJobRequest.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The identifier of the dominant language detection job to stop.

member.summary: This is the response object from the StopDominantLanguageDetectionJob operation.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The identifier of the dominant language detection job to stop.

member.summary:

Either STOP_REQUESTED if the job is currently running, or STOPPED if the job was previously stopped with the StopDominantLanguageDetectionJob operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.StopTrainingDocumentClassifierRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the StopTrainingDocumentClassifier operation. Stops a document classifier training job while in progress.
If the training job state is TRAINING, the job is marked for termination and put into the STOP_REQUESTED state. If the training job completes before it can be stopped, it is put into the TRAINED; otherwise the training job is stopped and put into the STOPPED state and the service sends back an HTTP 200 response with an empty HTTP body.

member.summary:

If the training job state is TRAINING, the job is marked for termination and put into the STOP_REQUESTED state. If the training job completes before it can be stopped, it is put into the TRAINED; otherwise the training job is stopped and putted into the STOPPED state and the service sends back an HTTP 200 response with an empty HTTP body.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.Tag
member.summary: A key-value pair that adds as a metadata to a resource used by Amazon Comprehend. For example, a tag with the key-value pair ‘Department’:’Sales’ might be added to a resource to indicate its use by a particular department.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.Tag.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
The initial part of a key-value pair that forms a tag associated with a given resource. For instance, if you want to show which resources are used by which departments, you might use “Department” as the key portion of the pair, with multiple possible values such as “sales,” “legal,” and “administration.”

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.Tag.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
The second part of a key-value pair that forms a tag associated with a given resource. For instance, if you want to show which resources are used by which departments, you might use “Department” as the initial (key) portion of the pair, with a value of “sales” to indicate the sales department.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TagResourceRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the TagResource operation. Associates a specific tag with an Amazon Comprehend resource. A tag is a key-value pair that adds as a metadata to a resource used by Amazon Comprehend. For example, a tag with "Sales" as the key might be added to a resource to indicate its use by the sales department.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TagResourceRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the given Amazon Comprehend resource to which you want to associate the tags.

member.summary:

Tags being associated with a specific Amazon Comprehend resource. There can be a maximum of 50 tags (both existing and pending) associated with a specific resource.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TopicsDetectionJobFilter
member.summary: Provides information for filtering topic detection jobs. For more information, see .

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TopicsDetectionJobFilter.JobName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property JobName.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TopicsDetectionJobFilter.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
Filters the list of topic detection jobs based on job status. Returns only jobs with the specified status.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TopicsDetectionJobFilter.SubmitTimeAfter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubmitTimeAfter.
Filters the list of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted for processing. Only returns jobs submitted after the specified time. Jobs are returned in ascending order, oldest to newest.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TopicsDetectionJobFilter.SubmitTimeBefore
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubmitTimeBefore.
Filters the list of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted for processing. Only returns jobs submitted before the specified time. Jobs are returned in descending order, newest to oldest.

member.summary:

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Management (IAM) role that grants Amazon Comprehend read access to your job data.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TopicsDetectionJobProperties.JobArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the topics detection job. It is a unique, fully qualified identifier for the job. It includes the AWS account, Region, and the job ID. The format of the ARN is as follows:
arn:<partition>:comprehend:<region>:<account-id>:topics-detection-job/<job-id>
The following is an example job ARN:
arn:aws:comprehend:us-west-2:111122223333:topics-detection-job/1234abcd12ab34cd56ef1234567890ab

The identifier assigned to the topic detection job.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TopicsDetectionJobProperties.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
The current status of the topic detection job. If the status is Failed, the reason for the failure is shown in the Message field.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TopicsDetectionJobProperties.Message
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Message.
A description for the status of a job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TopicsDetectionJobProperties.NumberOfTopics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NumberOfTopics.
The number of topics to detect supplied when you created the topic detection job. The default is 10.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TopicsDetectionJobProperties.OutputDataConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputDataConfig.
The output data configuration supplied when you created the topic detection job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TopicsDetectionJobProperties.SubmitTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubmitTime.
The time that the topic detection job was submitted for processing.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TopicsDetectionJobProperties.VolumeKmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VolumeKmsKeyId.
ID for the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key that Amazon Comprehend uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that process the analysis job. The VolumeKmsKeyId can be either of the following formats:
KMS Key ID: "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key: "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.TopicsDetectionJobProperties.VpcConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcConfig.
Configuration parameters for a private Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) containing the resources you are using for your topic detection job. For more information, see Amazon VPC.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.UnsupportedLanguageException
member.summary: Amazon Comprehend can't process the language of the input text. For custom entity recognition APIs, only English, Spanish, French, Italian, German, or Portuguese are accepted. For a list of supported languages, see supported-languages.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.UntagResourceRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UntagResource operation. Removes a specific tag associated with an Amazon Comprehend resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.UntagResourceRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the given Amazon Comprehend resource from which you want to remove the tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.UntagResourceRequest.TagKeys
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TagKeys.
The initial part of a key-value pair that forms a tag being removed from a given resource. For example, a tag with "Sales" as the key might be added to a resource to indicate its use by the sales department. Keys must be unique and cannot be duplicated for a particular resource.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.UntagResourceResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UntagResource operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.UpdateEndpointRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateEndpoint operation. Updates information about the specified endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.UpdateEndpointRequest.DesiredDataAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DesiredDataAccessRoleArn.
Data access role ARN to use in case the new model is encrypted with a customer CMK.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.UpdateEndpointRequest.DesiredInferenceUnits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DesiredInferenceUnits.
The desired number of inference units to be used by the model using this endpoint. Each inference unit represents of a throughput of 100 characters per second.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.UpdateEndpointRequest.DesiredModelArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DesiredModelArn.
The ARN of the new model to use when updating an existing endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.UpdateEndpointRequest.EndpointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointArn.
The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the endpoint being updated.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.UpdateEndpointResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateEndpoint operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.VpcConfig
member.summary: Configuration parameters for an optional private Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) containing the resources you are using for the job. For more information, see Amazon VPC.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.VpcConfig.SecurityGroupIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityGroupIds.
The ID number for a security group on an instance of your private VPC. Security groups on your VPC function serve as a virtual firewall to control inbound and outbound traffic and provides security for the resources that you’ll be accessing on the VPC. This ID number is preceded by "sg-", for instance: "sg-03b388029b0a285ea". For more information, see Security Groups for your VPC.

member.name: P:Amazon.Comprehend.Model.VpcConfig.Subnets
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subnets.
The ID for each subnet being used in your private VPC. This subnet is a subset of the a range of IPv4 addresses used by the VPC and is specific to a given availability zone in the VPC’s region. This ID number is preceded by "subnet-", for instance: "subnet-04ccf456919e69055". For more information, see VPCs and Subnets.
